detailed_results.input: The robot number 1 has a strategy to always avoid position 2 or eventually reach position 3.

I conclude therefore that, fortune being changeful and mankind steadfast in their ways, so long as the two are in agreement men are successful, but unsuccessful when they fall out. For my part I consider that it is better to be adventurous than cautious, because fortune is a woman, and if you wish to keep her under it is necessary to beat and ill-use her; and it is seen that she allows herself to be mastered by the adventurous rather than by those who go to work more coldly.
detailed_results.reasoning: Coalition/agent is changed (gold is <<Men>> with a global property; prediction uses <<I>> and no strategic modality for the whole formula). Temporal structure is missing (gold has G(...), prediction is non-temporal). The core meaning differs: gold states globally that being adventurous is equivalent to (matching fortune AND success); prediction instead gives two implications about fortune being favorable/unfavorable and does not mention success or the biconditional.

The prediction instead states a disjunction: either no human injury, or if there is injury then the robot is not at the scene. Connective structure and predicates differ, so the meaning is not preserved.

If we do not wish to fight, we can prevent the enemy from engaging us even though the lines of our encampment be merely traced out on the ground. All we need do is to throw something odd and unaccountable in his way.

Prediction changes the condition (uses !fight && enemy_engaged), changes the coalition name, and introduces a nested G with a contradictory antecedent (enemy_engaged -> G !enemy_engaged) rather than ensuring !engaged outright.
